caption: What a gem! Small, but awesome museum. The Andres Serrano exhibit was incredible. I highly recommend and had a lovely time visiting

I enjoyed both special exhibition and permeant exhibition so much. It was impressive that the curator try to merge contemporary works into the permeant exhibition. Also enjoyed free audio guide done by the artist himself. Thumbs up for the thoughtfulness :-)
The museum is centered around the work of Aristide Maillol. Temporary exhibitions complement his work. The exhibitions are of smaller volume.

Beautiful museum, very quiet and relaxing in the centre of Paris. There was no waiting line and we did not book tickets in advance. I kind of wish there was more about Maillol’s artwork and a bigger permanent collection. The prices are a little bit expensive for what there’s to see and the student reduction is really low.

We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The Serrano exhibition was a revelation and very well curated. The permanent collection of Maillol’s work was an added bonus and again the curation was excellent. We will certainly be recommending the museum to our friends.

The Maillol Museum located in Paris, held the works of Andres Serrano. An American artist with controversial pieces of art. This exposition included portraits, sculptures, photographs, and more. All on the themes of race, gender, social class, and Christianity. Many people might feel offended by the art works, as they can be perceived as disrespectful and offensive. I would recommend this expostion to those who aren't easily offended or frighthened. However those who are, shouldn't attend the museum in my opinion.
A gem of a museum! Don't miss the Andres Serrano exhibit happening now and you must enjoy the exhibit with Serrano's audio commentary.
I love Musée Maillol and its neighborhood. Exhibit was thought provoking and we enjoyed it very much.

They hosted an Andres Serrano exhibition, and this alone is a good enough reason for me to love this museum. The fact that his masterpiece Semen and Blood III was on display made it incredibly super extra special for me as a lifelong Metallica fan.

This is a very nice museum which is not far from Rodin's museum and house. I have just seen Fujita exhibition and I was absolutely delighted. The visual was very good.  The text, staging and scenery were adequate for the artist Fujita who spent much time having fun and creating at the same pace.
This is a lovely and quiet musée to see the paintings and sculptures of Aristide Maillol.

This was the first time for us to visit this museum and we were very pleased to have chosen this exhibition of what are referred to as “” the naive painters “ whose everyday employment created the focus of their visual art..they created brightly coloured work of overlooked artists.. A very engaging exhibition and we were totally pleased to have attended this exhibition...
Attended Steve McCurry exhibition and totally enjoyed every moment. An amazing range of photography across 3 floors. Expect to spend about 2-3 hours here

Not very impressed by the museum itself (too much body exposure for my taste), but the hyper realism exhibition was truly marvelous. A bit uncanny here and there and that just add up to the experience

The Steve McCurry exhibition is a must see! Go while it is still on. Impressive pictures arranged over 2 floors. Takes you around 1-2 hours to walk through the whole exhibition. There is an audioguide which explains you the story behind some of the pictures McCurry took. Overall, very impressive ans highly recommended. The permanent exhibition at the Maillol was not really my thing though but look out for the temporary ones!
Beautiful space. The permanent collection is ok. I really enjoyed the special Serrano exhibit
Musee Maillol is a gem.  I enjoyed both the permanent collection and the well put together Andres Serrano exhibit. Well done!

Superb exhibition of Steve McCURRY's photos that captures your eyes, feeds your questions, nourishes your curiosity, your desire for elsewhere and at the same time causes a tsunami of emotions in front of a moment captured on the spot, an expression on a face or a frozen moment and so animated by this energy of life. To discover urgently from an emergency  For young and old. We visited the exhibition on a Friday at 2 p.m. and there was a little crowd when we left at 4 p.m. Enjoy
A very nice museum with great exhibitions and history in the very center on the Rive Gauche.
Great museum, beautiful sculptures in the permanent collection and if you can see the Buhrle collection on impressionist and post impressionist art you will be delighted!

I saw Andres Serrano's "Portraits of America" at my time at Musée Maillol. It is a pretty powerful photo exhibition that shows the diverse faces of American life. Serrano shows people from everywere in the USA; homeless individuals, veterans, celebrities etc. Showing their unique stories. His straightforward style makes you focus on the person, encouraging thoughts on issues like race, class, and identity. Some photos might be uncomfortable to see, such as lynching or nudity, but these push you to think deeper about society. Overall, it was an interesting experience that I found somewhat enjoyable, for its honest look at people in America today.
Gorgeous Steve McCurry exhibition. Awesome work by the museum, curator and various teams involved in putting this together to showcase the sublime work of Mr McCurry!

Superbe expo de Steve McCurry  « The photograph is an undeniably powerful medium. Free from the constraints of language, and harnessing the unique qualities of a single moment frozen in time.” — Steve McCurry
Great exhibition about hyper-realism with different artists. Definitely worth a visit

I came here for the third time to see the  Steve MCcurry exhibition. The social distance was not respected. I booked my ticket for 4pm. The entire museum was so packed that one could barely see the photos. By curiosity, I checked the available tickets on their web at almost 5 pm and it shows that slot of 4:30 still had 7 spots left. I thought it was a joke. We were so packed already. Terrible visiting experience. Pity! The staff is very friendly.

I visited the museum during the Steve McCurry exhibition. His photos are beautiful, I really recommend going. Plus the museum has longer opening hours on Wednesdays, until 10pm, which makes it possible to go during the week and avoid even larger weekend crowds :)
One of my favorite Museum in Paris. Always new updates with Contemporary art 🖼 this time #SteveMcCurry 200 photos …
Small but very interesting even for occasion visitors like us.
Very small and really nothing to see. Spent 15 minutes after paying for the 17.5 euro entrance fee.
Small intimate private Museum. Blockbuster temporary exhibits are well structured. Maillol is an amazing artist worth the visit on its own.
Beautiful museum with wonderful works of art, a great use of space in this museum.  We are glad we went and would recommend  visiting this museum.

Nice museum not so big but riche with art. Part of it (the third floor) is dedicated to the permanent collection of the museum. The second part which is double in area of the first part is dedicated to temporary expositions hosted by the museum. The architecture of the building as well as the contents are worth visiting.
I went to see Andres Serrano's Portrait of America and highly recommend. Great storytelling, depiction and insider POV of everything America.
Super expo Steve McCurry  !
Lovely “small museum” in a fantastic location.
I saw the Steve Mccurry exhibit of his photographs and the museum was great. Very clean and easy to navigate.
Exellent exhibition and a lovely cafe in the garden.

I'm saying this as an art amateur and out of honesty - the audioguides are absolutely ruining the experience here, as of instance, im writing this comment while being cornered by 5 visitors in an alley of the museum that won't move as they are plugged to their audioguides. the constant bipping of the devices mixed with an ambient noise of audioguides voices added up to each other simply ruins the calm atmosphere one can come to seek in a museum. it is impossible to properly enjoy the exhibition with this unbearable and constant noise :)
